QuestionJSON.Question: Riley loves music and has recently developed an interest in computer science. They are now curious about how they could use algorithms to manipulate sound signals. Riley learns that an audio signal is essentially a sequence of numbers representing variations in air pressure over time. To change the speed of an audio signal without altering its pitch, which algorithm should Riley use?
QuestionJSON.Answer1: An algorithm that multiplies each number in the sequence by a constant
QuestionJSON.Answer2: An algorithm that inverts each number in the sequence
QuestionJSON.Answer3: An algorithm that shifts each number in the sequence right or left
QuestionJSON.Answer4: An algorithm that changes the sequence length by interpolation or decimation
QuestionJSON.Explanation: When the speed of an audio signal is changed without altering its pitch, its length changes. An algorithm that changes the sequence length by interpolation (increasing length) or decimation (reducing length) is therefore needed.
